descriptions.description: The libffi library provides a portable, high level programming interface to various calling conventions. This allows a programmer to call any function specified by a call interface description at run-time. FFI stands for Foreign Function Interface. A foreign function interface is the popular name for the interface that allows code written in one language to call code written in another language.

set.commands:
PACKAGE_NAME=libffi PACKAGE_VERSION=3.0.13
oegextract ${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}.tar.gz
configure --prefix=${OEG_BASE_DIR} --with-gnu-ld --with-sysroot=${OEG_BASE_DIR} --enable-shared --bindir=${OEG_BASE_BIN_DIR} --libdir=${OEG_BASE_LIB_DIR} ${CONFIGURE_HOST_PARA} make make install-strip DESTDIR=${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}
# error: includes are in lib/libffi-3.0.13/include/*.h mv ${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_LIB_DIR}/libffi-3.0.13/include ${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}/ rm -rf ${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_LIB_DIR}/libffi-3.0.13
cd "${OEG_INSTALL_DIR}${OEG_BASE_DIR}"
mv lib/* lib64/ rm -rf lib # TODO: Do we need to edit the .la files in lib64?
oegarchive ${PACKAGE_NAME}-${PACKAGE_VERSION}
